title: Easy individual apple puff pastry pies recipe
text:
Apple turnovers are simply one of my favourite things – I used to buy one from a bakery after school most days – and they’re a cinch to make. You don’t have to make triangles; somehow I feel semicircles look better if you’re serving them for dessert. It’s important to use both kinds of apple for the filling.

I rarely make puff pastry, it’s so labour-intensive and requires a cool kitchen. Ready-made stuff is very good, though, and I usually buy Dorset Puff Pastry.

Prep time: 15 minutes | Cooking time: 35 minutes

MAKES

four

INGREDIENTS

2 Bramley apples

2 eating apples

3 tbsp caster sugar

625g puff pastry

Flour, for dusting

1 egg, lightly beaten

Granulated sugar, for sprinkling

METHOD ...
